title: Authorizes town boards to pass a resolution requiring a deputy supervisor be an elective town board member
summary: Authorizes town boards to pass a resolution requiring that a deputy supervisor be an elective town board member.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         3113

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. CALHOUN -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Local Governments

       AN ACT to amend the town law, in relation to authorizing towns to pass a
         resolution requiring the deputy supervisor be an elective  town  board
         member

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 42 of the town law, as amended by  chapter  808  of
    2  the laws of 1972, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  42.  Deputy  supervisor. The town board of any town may at any time
    4  establish the office of deputy supervisor. The deputy  supervisor  shall
    5  be  appointed by the supervisor to serve at the pleasure of the supervi-
    6  sor, and in case the office of  supervisor  becomes  vacant  any  deputy
    7  supervisor  in  office at the time such vacancy occurs shall continue to
    8  serve until the successor of such deputy supervisor is appointed. If the
    9  supervisor shall fail to appoint a deputy supervisor  within  five  days
   10  after the establishment of the office or within five days after a vacan-
   11  cy occurs in the office, the town board shall have power to appoint such
   12  deputy  supervisor. During the absence or inability to act of the super-
   13  visor, or while the office of supervisor is vacant, the deputy  supervi-
   14  sor  shall  preside, when present, at the meetings of the town board and
   15  shall be vested with all of the powers and may perform all of the duties
   16  of the supervisor under this chapter or any other law, except that he OR
   17  SHE shall have no vote in his OR HER capacity as  deputy  supervisor  on
   18  matters  coming before the town board and he OR SHE shall not serve as a
   19  member of the county board of supervisors. Any person, including a  town
   20  officer,  official  or  employee,  may  be  appointed deputy supervisor,
   21  provided that the person appointed shall possess the same qualifications
   22  as an elective town officer, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT A TOWN BOARD  SHALL
   23  HAVE  THE AUTHORITY TO PASS A RESOLUTION REQUIRING THE DEPUTY SUPERVISOR
   24  BE AN ELECTIVE TOWN BOARD MEMBER.  Before he OR SHE  shall  perform  any

    1  function  as such, the deputy supervisor shall take and file the consti-
    2  tutional oath of office and execute and file an official undertaking  in
    3  the  manner prescribed in section twenty-five of this [chapter] ARTICLE.
    4  The  town  board  shall fix the compensation which the deputy supervisor
    5  shall receive, which compensation  may  be  in  addition  to  any  other
    6  compensation  he  OR SHE may receive as a town officer, town official or
    7  town employee.
    8    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
